snippet: California courts should continue to allow cameras at trials but should ban them from pretrial proceedings and most hearings held without the jury present,  a task force has recommended.         The committee was appointed by state court leaders a...
lead_paragraph: California courts should continue to allow cameras at trials but should ban them from pretrial proceedings and most hearings held without the jury present, a task force has recommended. The committee was appointed by state court leaders after the O. J. Simpson trial raised questions about whether television coverage had affected the proceedings.

headline.main: Task Force Recommends Limits On Camera Coverage of Courts
